description: From French clinquant, from clinquer (“to clink”), from Dutch klinken (“to sound, ring, clink”), from Middle Dutch clinken, clingen, from Old Dutch *clingan, from Proto-West Germanic *klingan, from Proto-Germanic *klinganą (“to sound, ring”). Cognate with German klingen (“to sound”).

adjectives.description: clinquant (comparative more clinquant, superlative most clinquant)

entries.meaning: Glittery; gleaming; sparkling; dressed in, or overlaid with, tinsel finery.
